snippet: Leung Chun-ying is the man on whom China is relying to quell the pro-democracy demonstrations in Hong Kong. He has also become a main target of the protest.
abstract: Leung Chun-ying, chief executive of Hong Kong, is the man Chinese Pres Xi Jinping is relying on to quell enormous pro-democracy protests that have gripped city and pose one of biggest challenges in years to Communist Party rule; at same time, Leung is main target of protests.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Alan Wong and Keith Bradsher from Hong Kong, Didi Kirsten Tatlow from Beijing, and Michael Forsythe from New Haven. Mia Li contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Leung Chun-ying is the man on whom China is relying to quell the pro-democracy demonstrations in Hong Kong. He has also become a main target of the protest.

headline.main: Squeezed by Protesters and Beijing, Leader Tries to Save His Job
headline.print_headline: Squeezed by Protesters and Beijing, Leader Tries to Save His Job
